ud5.1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud5.1:1.3: Now at that time King Pasenadi of Kosala was upstairs in the royal longhouse together with Queen Mallikā.
ud5.1:1.4: Then King Pasenadi addressed Queen Mallikā,
ud5.1:1.5: “Mallikā, is there anyone more dear to you than yourself?”
ud5.1:2.2: But is there anyone more dear to you than yourself?”
ud5.1:3.1: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala came downstairs from the stilt longhouse, went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.
ud5.1:5.1: Then, understanding this matter, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud5.1:6.1: “Having explored every quarter with the mind,
ud5.1:6.3: Likewise for others, each holds themselves dear;
ud5.1:6.4: so one who loves themselves would harm no other.”
